metadata.title: Erowid Pregabalin (Lyrica) Vault
metadata.description: Information about Pregabalin (Lyrica) including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.

content:
Drug: Pregabalin | cid: 5486971
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Pregabalin (Lyrica) including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: pregabalin
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Pregabalin



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Lyrica

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Anelgesic; Anticonvulsant; Anxiolytic

CHEMICAL NAME

(S)-3-(aminomethyl)-5-methylhexanoic acid

DESCRIPTION

Pregabalin is a GABA derivative used to treat neuropathic pain and seizures. It is approved for treatment of anxiety disorders in the EU. A small number of users (~4%) report euphoria after use, which led to its control in the U.S.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

RELATED VAULTS #

Gabapentin (Neurontin)

EXPERIENCES #

Amazingly Spiritual, by Absinthe750mL

Heart Arrhythmia, Seizure : Not Recreational, by Altair

Observations Over 4 Years of Usage, by MrLyrica

Long-Term Use and High Dosages, by Panopticon

Closed Eye Visuals Similar to Lucid Dreaming, by R9T3

» » » MORE » » »

RESEARCH & JOURNAL ARTICLES #

Pregabalin and gabapentin in opioid overdose deaths - EMCDDA DRD/DRID Expert Meeting, 2014


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is the main informational section of Erowid's pregabalin (Lyrica) page within the Pharmaceuticals Vault, summarizing its names, effects, chemical details, uses, user experiences, related substances, and links to further research and user reports.

                    Context: 
                    This chunk is from the pregabalin (Lyrica) page on Erowid, appearing after user-submitted experience reports. It introduces research articles on pregabalin and gabapentin, followed by curated external resources including primary medical references, secondary overviews, government publications, and media coverage related to pregabalin’s uses, effects, regulation, and abuse potential.

                    Context: 
                    This section from the Erowid Pregabalin (Lyrica) information page lists government articles and media coverage related to pregabalin's approval, scheduling, and use, including its FDA approval for fibromyalgia, DEA scheduling, and news reports covering withdrawal concerns, effectiveness for shingles and fibromyalgia, and patient experiences. It appears near the end of the pregabalin entry, following research articles and links to primary and secondary drug information sources.
